sentences.sentence: At least 18 migrants have died after 2,000 people attempted to cross from Morocco into its neighboring Spanish enclave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Two people were killed and more than a dozen were injured in a shooting outside a bar in Norway's capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The incident took place outside the London pub in Oslo, a popular LGBTQ plus nightclub, and it took place hours before the city's pride parade was meant to start.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to a police statement, the incident is being investigated as a terrorist attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: A police task leader at the scene told reporters, As far as it is possible to be certain right now, the shooter acted alone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: We have him in custody and we do also have control of the weapons used in the shooting. I was here relatively early and there were several people here giving first aid treatment to those who were injured. So it is noteworthy that they took action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: After the shooting, Oslo Pride cancelled all events associated with Pride due to the recommendation from the police, and the group called on people not to show up to the city's Pride parade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Authorities are investigating if there is any connection between the shooting and Pride events originally scheduled for Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: European Union chief Josip Borre will meet Iranian Foreign Minister Amir Abdullahiyeh in Tehran for new talks about the 2015 nuclear deal. Discussions

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: to return the US to the deal have been stalled since March. The US's refusal to remove the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps from their terror list led to a breakdown in discussions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: terrorist led to a breakdown in discussions. Bure announced his surprise visit on Twitter, saying diplomacy will be the only way through the tensions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The deal, formerly known as the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, gave Iran relief from sanctions for guarantees they will not develop a nuclear weapon, something Tehran has always denied wanting to do.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The US withdrew from the deal in 2018 before imposing tough sanctions on Iran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But Iranian officials say they are serious about reaching an agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 18 migrants have died and another 76 were injured after trying to cross from Morocco into Spain's Malaya enclave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The casualties occurred after 2,000 migrants attempted to storm a high fence that separates the North African country from its EU neighbor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: More than 100 people were able to cross the boundary after a two-hour skirmish with border officers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Moroccan guards reportedly deployed a large amount of force to try to prevent people from crossing the border. Once across, around 130 men were taken to a reception center for immigrants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over the past decade, migrants have tried to cross into the Spanish enclave as a route into Europe, though it is heavily guarded. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For some, village supply lines could be cut at any moment and volunteers are working to evacuate those residents who haven't already fled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But some refuse to leave, saying they would rather be united with the Russians.

sentences.sentence: Thousands of people in Georgia took to the streets in the country's capital, demanding for the resignation of its prime minister.

sentences.sentence: The protest comes after the EU gave candidate status to Ukraine and Moldova, but not Georgia.

sentences.sentence: The demonstrators blame the country's government for the rejection.

sentences.sentence: He said, here we are the citizens fighting for Georgia's European future, for the EU,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: An American woman is finally receiving treatment for a partial miscarriage in Spain after being denied an abortion in Malta.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Andrea Prudent was medically evacuated to the Spanish island of Mallorca on Thursday to begin the treatment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: She's exhausted, but relieved, and her physical condition is stable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: She's safe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: She has to terminate the pregnancy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So for the next two days, she's going to be in labor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She's going to sleep all day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's 9 at 11. They're going to begin inducing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She's going to have contractions and have to go through a miscarriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While on vacation in Malta, Prudence started to bleed heavily after she suffered from a partial miscarriage that was considered life-threatening. Despite this, she was denied an abortion because Malta outlaws the procedure under any circumstance, forcing her to leave the country. In response to her story, abortion rights activists protested the country's strict rules outside of Malta's parliament. And the country's Women Rights Foundation filed a petition demanding that the country decriminalize the procedure.
